definition: pillbox (military fortification)/blockhouse/euphemistic way of writing 屌爆[diao3 bao4]
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: The tall blockhouse on the right used to be a jail for women.
sentences.chinese: 右手边这个碉堡样的建筑据说原来是关女囚的。

sentences.english: The enemy pillbox was blown up with a bang.
sentences.chinese: 轰的一声，敌人的碉堡给炸飞了。

sentences.english: Bunker build time decreased from 40 to 30 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 碉堡的建造时间从40秒调整为30秒。

sentences.english: German pillbox for 88mm gun located on strong point WN72.
sentences.chinese: 德国碉堡上的强项WN72位于88毫米枪。

sentences.english: Scratch one pillbox, " the lieutenant said."
Our army destroyed the enemy's blockhouse with a rocket bomb.
sentences.chinese: 我军利用火箭弹炸毁了敌军的碉堡。

sentences.english: The enemy besieged in the blockhouse .
sentences.chinese: 敌军被我们围困在碉堡中。

sentences.english: The enemy soldiers surrendered their arms, and came out from the blockhouse.
sentences.chinese: 敌军士兵放下武器从碉堡中走了出来。

sentences.english: The enemy were besieged in the blockhouse .
sentences.chinese: 敌军被我们围困在碉堡中。

sentences.english: They drove us at bayonet point to build blockhouses for them.
sentences.chinese: 他们用刺刀逼着我们给他们修碉堡。

sentences.english: But that's it. No more building forts or tunneling through snowbanks.
sentences.chinese: 反正，你不再在雪堆里堆碉堡和挖隧道了。

sentences.english: The Hudson 's Bay Company erected a blockhouse here in1833. Population, 47, 069.
sentences.chinese: 1833年，哈得逊的海湾公司在这里建起一座碉堡。

sentences.english: A line of forts was built along the border to protect the country against attack.
sentences.chinese: 边界沿线构筑了碉堡，以防敌人进攻该国。

sentences.english: The army trained its cannon on the fort .
sentences.chinese: 这支军队把一门大炮对准了那座碉堡。

sentences.english: These areas become well-guarded bunkers, or silos.
sentences.chinese: 这些势力范围成为戒备森严的碉堡或者筒仓。

sentences.english: We told him to pick out a pillbox and left fly.
sentences.chinese: 我们跟他说把某个碉堡炸飞。

definition: defensive structure/military fortifications/(Tw) construction works/civil engineering works
big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
